resources.string: Visit the University of Toronto UTogether website for more information & support.
This assessment is not a replacement for medical advice. If you are experiencing severe symptoms or have other concerns, please seek medical attention.
Screening must be completed before coming on campus.
This assessment is not a replacement for medical advice. If you are experiencing severe symptoms or have other concerns, please seek medical attention.

All members of the University of Toronto community are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be on University campuses and premises. Please confirm your vaccination status below as part of your UCheck health screening.

Based on your answers, you do not report symptoms of COVID-19 and can continue to come to campus as planned. Please continue to abide by all applicable public health requirements, remember to wear a mask, and abide by all University posted signage. You must ensure that your manager, supervisor, or University contact person has your up-to-date contact information prior to coming on site.
This self-assessment does not confirm a negative diagnosis of COVID-19.
If you are in an at-risk group, are receiving this \'green status\' for the first time, and:
• You are a student, please contact your local health care provider or campus Health & Wellness/Health & Counseling Centre before you arrive on campus/leave your residence.
• You are a Faculty, Librarian, or Staff member, and require an alternative work arrangement or potential accommodation, please contact Health & Well-Being.
Complete this self-assessment to generate your COVID-19 risk status.

Based on your selected responses, you may have symptoms of COVID-19, or may have been exposed to COVID-19. You should not come to campus as planned. If you live in residence, please self-isolate and immediately contact residence staff.
Please note, this self-assessment does not confirm a diagnosis of COVID-19.
Please proceed by following the recommendations below.
